name: Catamaran Resort Hotel and Spa

reviews.text: We are currently at the Catamaran Resort & spa Hotel. Our room is a bayview studio suite on the 8th floor (Room 853)with amazing views of the bay and of the Ocean. We booked the room for 4 nights and I have to say that although I am normally very picky about hotel rooms, the view from our room far outweighed my displeasure at how dated the room is. The carpet is a little bit worn and the bathroom and kitchen tiny, but the beddings are clean and the maid comes in to clean our room and wash our dishes each day.
reviews.title: Dated rooms,Great Location,Fantastic views

reviews.text: I think the best part of Catamaran is location,location,location... My husband and kids are having a ball sufing,kayaking and sailing from the watersport facility at the hotel and surfing right across the road on Pacific beach .
reviews.title: catamaran well suits the pacific beach area

reviews.text: Despite the dated rooms we would come back again and book a bayview studio suite as we are having a fantastic time.
reviews.title: You get what you Pay For at the Catamaran -"ish"

likes.disliked: — other than location, it never seemed to get the little things right compared to the price paid

reviews.title: Great family vacation in the perfect spot!
reviews.text: Our party of three stayed at the Catamaran Sept.21-26, 2007.

reviews.title: Anniversary in San Diego
reviews.text: We were on the 9th floor of the tower with a bay view room. We had only signed up for a garden view room, so were happy for the complimentary upgrade. The view out of the patio was wonderful.

reviews.title: Catamaran Sorely In Need of an Update
reviews.text: We stayed at the Catamaran Resort Hotel one night-- we were supposed to be there for four but left as soon as we possibly could. Hotel is dingy, REALLY in need of a MAJOR facelift and very noisy. Our room smelled dank and the carpet was coming up in many spots. All this for some $525 a night for one room! Granted, it is on Mission Bay and across the street from the Pacific Ocean but the area is very seedy-- we saw four arrests in the 20 hours we were there. We felt like we were in an episode of COPS. The staff was very nice and the birds are cute for the kids but those pluses pale in comparison to the the minuses.

I had high hopes regarding this hotel. I went with my son, who is 4 and my mom. THe room wasn't ready when we arrived which was after the check in time which was irritating, but the lady that checked us in was very nice. An hour later when the room was ready we checked in.
reviews.title: Place was OK...

reviews.text: The hotel is definitely old and dated. Dingy hallways with bad lighting. The room was nice though. Nice comforters and very clean. We had a kitchen which was nice. If you stay here though don't plan on doing much cooking in the kitchen. 3 of the burners on the electric stove where broken and the stove was very old.
reviews.title: Everything relaxed including the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But it was nice to have a microwave and a refrigerator.
reviews.title: OK, but ridiculously overpriced for what you get

likes.disliked: — very mediocre rooms for an extortionate price

reviews.text: The hotel was very loud. Many kids running around. We could here everything our neighbors did upstairs and people outside of our room.
reviews.title: Perfect stay!!! Catamaran has it all!

likes.disliked: — water pressure could be a little better

reviews.text: We stayed at the Catamaran for 3 nights in mid-August (mid-week). Check-in was no problem and our room was in the Tower (3rd floor). Overall the room was clean and everything worked ok. The carpet was in bad shape in a number of places and the sliding door to the balcony was in dire need of repair. The door would open but the sides of the door would wobble badly when the door was opened. The balcony was nice but very dusty. We think the maids would dump the dirt/dust from the rooms above and it landed on the balcony of the lower rooms. This meant that each evening everything that was left on the balcony (towels) was covered with a fine layer of dirt and dust. Our travel agent had told us the room would have two queen beds, in reality all the double rooms (according to the front desk) had double beds, and not queens. Not a big deal unless you’re expecting to get 2 people to bed -- the smaller beds made for very uncomfortable sleeping. Lesson learned – check with the hotel about the rooms if you have any doubts. We ended up having one of the kids sleep on a fold-out-bed, not comfortable but better than the previous night. We went to the family BBQ that was on Wednesday night on the beach at the hotel, the food was ok. A bit pricey for BBQ, but we enjoyed it. We went on the free cruise around the bay. Is you time it right you can take the cruise during the Sea World fireworks – the kids enjoyed that but were mostly bored by the cruise (not much to see or do for kids). We had heard the beach right across the street from the hotel had a more rowdy crowd so we decided to go to La Jolla for the beach. La Jolla was an easy, quick drive and the beaches were beautiful. We ate dinner most nights at the hotels restaurant. The food and service were fine, except for one night. One night we went to the restaurant and along with everyone else in our section ended up waiting 30 to 40 minutes for menus and to even see our waiter for the first time. I made a number of trips to talk with the manager, who said the waiter was on their way, but again we waited. Normally we would have left but we were going on the cruise that night and didn’t want to waste any more time driving somewhere. Eventually a waiter was sent, he offered a lame excuse (they were very busy and understaffed) and apology and that was it – we expected maybe a free drink or appetizer but we but got nothing for the wait. The restaurant manager never even stopped by to say anything to us, or the 3 other tables that also waited. The pool area was nice and the bar made it easy to get a quick drink. The game room is located by the pool and all games are free - the kids loved that. Although the hotel is badly in need of an upgrade we did enjoy the tropical feel of the resort. Unless the hotel gets upgraded soon we probably would consider other resorts before the Catamaran.
reviews.title: Nice Tropical Feel, But A Bit Outdated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front drive of the Catamaran looks as impressive as the pictures on the internet. Sadly, I couldn't say the same for the rest of the hotel. It could certainly do with a make over. It's not awful, just a bit more dated than we were expecting.
reviews.title: Not bad but not what we were expecting

reviews.text: The reception desk was very helpful. We didn't like the first room they gave us (ground floor next to the elevator and very noisey) so they quickly changed our room to a better spot. The room was great, spacious, clean, nice patio and a good sized bathroom.
reviews.title: Sleepless in San Diego

reviews.text: The beach was nice, although the sun loungers were in short supply. You had to be at the beach by 9.30am to get one! As it is on the bay rather than the ocean it is particually good for kids.
reviews.title: It was ok

reviews.text: Each day there were different events, BBQ, dinner cruise etc which were excellent. You can also go tot he sister hotel, the Bahia.
reviews.title: Mixed Review - Mostly Positive

likes.disliked: — The dated carpet in the hallways

reviews.text: I would firstly like to say that we had high hope for this hotel.
reviews.title: Huge Disappointment not 4 star hotel

reviews.text: On check in we were advised our room wouldn't be ready until after 4PM - this seems bit late to me but my fault because I didn't check first. After we had waited around we were given room 355 - do NOT stay in this room carpet was bare in places, it was dark and dingy, smelt revolting, the furniture was chipped, kitchen shabby and the shower didn't work. When I called reception I was told the hotel was full and we were unable to be moved I was furious but tired so I didn't pursue this. The following evening at 8.30 we were disturbed by what seemed to be hammering and drilling I called reception again and they apologised for the disturbance. The following morning I called again as there was still hammering and complained again I was then told that they were refurbishing the floor below us and this would take place for the duration of our stay. I am a travel agent and for this not to be disclosed at time of booking or when we checked in is shocking but can happen to us too! I called the front of house manager immediatley and advised this was totally unacceptable. We were offer to be moved almost straight away to a room on the 12th floor with city and ocean view as the room was exactly the same I was not keen we were eventually offered an upgrade
reviews.title: Room could e mod

likes.liked: — Staff, free internet access, proximity to other attractions
likes.disliked: — Kitchenette, room could use refreshing, co$t on weekends

reviews.text: to a bayfront room but as this did not have a kitchenette we declined
reviews.title: In need of modernisation

likes.liked: — The well manicured grounds with the willdlife roaming freely around
likes.disliked: — The outdated decoration, uncomfotable beds and bed linen that did not fit the beds properly. The antique beach furniture which was falling apart

reviews.text: the offer and moved up - this was MUCH better. Grounds and reception are lovely, pool was clean, evening strolls around the bay were lovely. I didn't think much of the beach and surrounding area it seemed to be full of college kids drinking and clearly taking drugs with total disregard for anyone around - definatley not my kind of area I do not go to the beach to be constantly worrying about my son.
reviews.title: Catamran Resort
A Great Beach Location
reviews.text: The restaurant is overpriced in my opinion. Service was bad and food not great.

description: Our HOT Tip: Like the Catamaran Resort on Face Book and save up to 15% off the best available rates. The Catamaran’s 313 rooms and suites are spacious and tastefully appointed with their own balcony or patio. Mission Bay, the world’s largest aquatic park, is at your doorstep and the enticing waves of the Pacific Ocean are just 100 yards away. Enjoy marvelous views of the California coastline or stunning city skyline from every part of our beach resort. In San Diego, activities and local attractions are never far away. Visit the world famous San Diego Zoo, historic Old Town, and SeaWorld. Whether staying at the Catamaran Resort for pleasure or business, you’ll experience San Diego, one of Southern California’s most exciting cities, in all its fascinating and colorful detail.
